alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:22PM CST until January 27 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Wharton, Austin, Colorado and Fort Bend Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 17.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 04/20/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 16.2 Wed 10 pm CS 16.9 13.5 10.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1030 AM CST.
